subtitle: A set dessert. Serve with lashings of cream or yogurt.

method.text: Place sugar, eggs and vanilla essence in a bowl. Whisk together until very thick and pale.
In a separate bowl, whisk cream until it forms soft peaks. Carefully fold into the sugar mixture with the yogurt.

Sprinkle gelatine over 45 ml cold water in a heatproof bowl and leave to soak for 3 min. Place bowl over a pan of simmering water and heat gently for 3-5 min until dissolved. Set aside to cool slightly.

Place strawberries in a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Stir in half the gelatine and leave to thicken slightly.  Stir remaining gelatine into the cream mixture and leave to thicken slightly. Spoon the cream mixture into a lightly greased 1.15 litre loaf tin lined with cling film.
Add the strawberry puree. Mix in to give a marbled effect. Smooth over the surface. Leave to set in a fridge.
Turn the terrine out onto a serving plate. Remove the cling film. Decorate the top with strawberry slices and the sides of the terrine with lemon zest.  Serve well chilled in slices.

title: Marbled strawberry terrine
